Package nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.domain.Tile

Class Tile

java.lang.Object
nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.domain.Tile.Tile
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExitLock, FreeTile, Wall
public class Tile extends Object
Represents a generic tile in the game board. This class provides the base for all tile types, defining common attributes and operations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Tile(Coord loc)
    Constructs a new Tile instance at the specified location.

    • Tile

      public Tile(Coord loc)
      Constructs a new Tile instance at the specified location.
      Parameters:
      loc - The coordinates where this tile is located.

  • Method Details

    • getLocation

      public Coord getLocation()
      Retrieves the location of this tile.
      Returns:
      The coordinates of this tile's location.

    • getEntity

      public Entity getEntity()
      Retrieves the entity residing on this tile.
      Returns:
      The entity on this tile, or null if none.

    • setEntity

      public void setEntity(Entity entity)
      Sets the entity to reside on this tile.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to be placed on this tile.

    • tileAtLoc

      public static Optional<Tile> tileAtLoc(Coord loc, Board board)
      Finds a tile based on a given location within a specific board.
      Parameters:
      loc - The coordinate to check.
      board - The game board to search within.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found tile, or empty if none found.

    • moveEntity

      public void moveEntity(Tile swap)
      Performs an entity move from another tile to this tile.
      Parameters:
      swap - The source tile from which the entity will be moved.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the source tile is null.

    • enemyWalkeable

      public boolean enemyWalkeable()
      Determines if this tile is walkable by an enemy entity. By default, this returns false and can be overridden by subclasses.
      Returns:
      true if enemies can walk over this tile; false otherwise.
